meanings.definition: Relating to or consisting of notation.
meanings.sent1: The notational system used in music helps musicians read and play notes.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the notational rules for solving math problems.
meanings.sent3: The notational way the chef wrote down the recipe made it easy for anyone to follow.
meanings.sent4: Her notational handwriting was so neat that it looked like printed text.
meanings.sent5: The notational symbols on the map guided us through the hiking trail.

meanings.definition: Representing something by means of written symbols.
meanings.sent1: The notational on the map indicated the location of the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: In the notational for the foreign language, each character had a specific meaning.
meanings.sent3: The notational in the ancient manuscript was so intricate that it puzzled historians.
meanings.sent4: His notational of love was a heartfelt letter written in beautiful calligraphy.
meanings.sent5: The notational on the road signs helped drivers navigate through the city.

meanings.definition: Expressing or representing something in a symbolic form.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a notational painting that conveyed deep emotions.
meanings.sent2: Her notational dance performance left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The notational way he expressed gratitude was by giving a small gift.
meanings.sent4: The notational gesture of holding hands symbolized unity and support.
meanings.sent5: The notational design of the logo represented growth and innovation.
